sen.j: ハルマ和解（はるまわげ、波留麻和解）は、日本最初の蘭和辞典。
sen.e: Haruma Wage is the first Dutch-Japanese dictionary.

sen.e: Haruma Wage is the first Dutch-Japanese dictionary.

sen.j: 寛政8年（1796年）蘭学者の稲村三伯、宇田川玄随、岡田甫説らによって編纂された。

sen.e: It was compiled by Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) Sanbaku INAMURA, Genzui UDAGAWA, and Hosetu OKADA and others in 1796.

sen.j: 蘭学の勃興により、蘭和辞典が求められた。
sen.e: With the rise of Western studies, a Dutch-Japanese dictionary was sought

sen.j: 長崎通詞の西善三郎は蘭日辞典編纂に着手したが、編纂作業中に死去し未完成に終わった。
sen.e: Zenzaburo NISHI, a Dutch interpreter in Nagasaki started to compile a Dutch-Japanese Dictionary; however, he died while he was working on compilation, so his work was unfinished.
Zenzaburo NISHI, a Dutch interpreter in Nagasaki started to compile a Dutch-Japanese Dictionary; however, he died while he was working on compilation and his work was unfinished.

sen.j: 膨大なオランダ語の単語をABC順に並べる作業に、多大な労力が必要だったのである。
sen.e: A great deal of labor was needed to arrange enormous Dutch words in the order of ABC.

sen.j: 大槻玄沢門下の稲村三伯が蘭和辞典の必要性を痛感し、編纂活動を開始した。
sen.e: Sanbaku INAMURA, Gentaku OTSUKI's disciple keenly felt the need of Dutch-Japanese Dictionary and started the activity of compilation again.
Sanbaku INAMURA, Gentaku OTSUKI's disciple keenly felt the need of Dutch-Japanese Dictionary and started the activity of compilation again.

sen.j: 稲村三伯は、長崎通詞で西善三郎の遺志を継いで編纂事業に当たっていた石井恒右衛門を紹介され、フランス人フランソワ・ハルマ(François Halma)の「蘭仏辞書」（1729年）の日本語訳を作る要領で蘭日辞典編纂に取り組んだ。
sen.e: Sanbaku INAMURA was introduced to Tsuneemon ISHII who was compiling the Dutchh-Japanese Dictionary continuing the will of the deceased Zenzaburo NISH, Dutch interpreter in Nagasaki, and tackled the business of compilation of the Dutch-Japanese Dictionary by using the format of the "Dictionary of the Dutch and French Languages" complied by French Francois Halma (published in 1729).

sen.e: By using the format used in the "Dictionary of the Dutch and French Languages" he was totally able to avoid the labor of arranging words of enormous Dutch in the order of ABC.

sen.e: Besides Sanbaku INAMURA, scholars with whom Sanbaku studied together under Gentaku OTSUKI participated in this project; they were Genzui UDAGAWA and Hosetsu OKADA.

sen.j: 編纂事業は寛政8年（1796年）に終わり、収録語数6万4035語、全13巻に渡る『ハルマ和解（波留麻和解）』として完成を見た。
sen.e: The business of compilation ended in 1796; the number of words included in the dictionary was 64,035 and was consisted of 13 volumes; the title was made as ''Haruma Wage."
The compilation was finished in 1796 to complete the dictionary titled ''Haruma Wage" which included 64,035 words in 13 volumes.
